name: Ilberg

attributes.attribute: contender for the post of leadership
retired to his palace at the magical waterfall of Assaroe

sources: Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.
text: A deity named Ilberg was once considered as a potential leader for the Tuatha Dé Danann, the gods of ancient Ireland, when the outgoing fertility god, the Dagda, decided to give up his position. Ilberg, who was the offspring of Manannán Mac Lir, the god of the sea, ultimately did not acquire the role and instead retired to his castle situated at the enchanting Assaroe waterfall.
